text.p: Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp, one of the world's largest telecommunications service providers, chose Raptor Systems Inc's Eagle firewall security component for its NEW BL-3000 program, Raptor said on Thursday.

Firewalls are designed to protect companies' internal computer networks from outside intruders. Raptor's Eagle firewall will supply internal network protection as well as security for communications with outside computers using NTT's private network, Raptor added.
The New BL-3000 information system is a network software program that NTT uses in its network systems integration business.
Terms of the agreement between Raptor and NTT were not disclosed.
"NTT believes the demand for security devices like the Eagle firewall will dramatically increase in the coming years," Raptor said in a statement.
Raptor was 5/8 higher at 12 early Wednesday afternoon.
